Title.evidence: we designed a randomized controlled trial

Trial_Design.evidence: patients undergoing thoracoscopic lobectomy were randomly assigned

Intervention.evidence: dynamic lung compliance group that received individualized PEEP guided by the maximum dynamic pulmonary compliance or a conventional ventilation group with a fixed PEEP of 5 cm H 2 O

Objective.evidence: to assess whether titrating PEEP to the maximum dynamic lung compliance in patients undergoing lung resection surgery impacts the occurrence of postoperative pulmonary complications (PPCs)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was a composite of PPCs occurring within seven days

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: patients undergoing thoracoscopic lobectomy were randomly assigned

Result_Outcome.evidence: Patients in the conventional ventilation group experienced 38% postoperative pulmonary complications versus 20% in the dynamic lung compliance group compared with the control group ( P <â€‰0.01)

Trial_Registration.evidence: This study was registered at the Chinese Clinical Trials Registry on 04/07/2021 with registration number ChiCTR2100048201
